reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC CONSERVATIVE GAINS MA

text.title: CONSERVATIVE GAINS MAY SPEED FINNISH MARKET REFORM
text.author: By Simon Haydon Reuters
text.body: Conservative gains Finnish general elections could speed liberalisation financial markets though there be radical economic restructuring conservative officials economic analysts conservatives gained nine new seats parliament after two day elections ended yesterday political commentators say social democrat Prime Minister Kalevi Sorsa likely to be replaced by centre right coalition International spokesman Pasi Natri told Reuters we willing to liberalise economy as much as possible Helsinki analysts outgoing centre left coalition introduced major reforms money stock markets period government between They Finnish conservatives bore little resemblance to other European conservative movements example shelved privatisation policies to increase their popularity Finnish trade affairs dominated by special ties neighbour Soviet Union new centre right coalition could alter relationship analysts two countries long term pact under trade must be balanced value accord signed January agreed bilateral trade totalling billion markka Finland exports finished products to USSR crude oil accounting pct imports Centre Party before elections Fenno Soviet trade to be cut because Finland to trim exports when value Moscow s oil exports to Finland fell Finnish financial markets reacted cautiously to election news little movement markka or on Helsinki stock exchange Securities analysts market respond positively if centre right coalition formed but added too early to exclude possibility social democrats hang on to power spokesman conservatives favoured legislation governing stock market to prevent casino style behaviour He conservatives also favoured establishment internal market between Nordic countries International capital markets were becoming more more important he adding conservatives speed up development Finland s capial markets He conservatives supported bilateral trade ties Moscow but links western Europe should be studied Finland member European Free Trade Association EFTA Negotiations between major Finnish political parties likely to be protracted shape new government probably be established before start April Conservatives hold seats now Centre Party gained three to social democrats lost one now hold seats

text.body: Two new U K Tax relief measures oil producers announced today aimed at encouraging developments North Sea to go ahead boost opportunities offshore supplies industry Inland Revenue post budget statement Earlier Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson announced his annual budget to Parliament today companies be allowed to offset up to pct qualifying development expenditure on certain future oil fields against Petroleum Revenue Tax PRT To date full relief allowed expenditure on individual field itself when income stream began but immediately available against other development expenditure statement new relief apply to fields outside southern basin development consent first given on or after today improve post tax economics new developments encourage companies to proceed project might been delayed Lawson also announced he henceforth allow certain expenditure on oil related research does at present qualify PRT relief to be offset against PRT liability means oil related expenditure U K Or on U K Continental shelf become allowable particular field within three years being incurred to be allowed against PRT liability any oil field Inland Revenue brings scope PRT relief research costs more line corporation tax relief measures planned to encourage general research into ways reducing field development costs due course industry should benefit by over stg year calculated Inland Revenue statement also included other technical measures Lawson did comment on his budget speech These included measures to allow companies to balance their shares PRT exempt oil allowances through reallocation two past periods allowance utilisation Tidier rules on incorrectly allowed PRT expenditure reliefs were announced while there were also ammendments on rules on corporation tax Advance Corporation Tax relating to so called ring fence activities U K continental shelf Finance Bill provisions implementation measures announced November Gareth Lewis Davies North Sea expert stockbrokers Wood Mackenzie Co Inc Edinburgh thought two reliefs on PRT help depressed offshore industry He pct cross field allowance relief favour chances development smaller North Sea fields such Osprey Don Arbroath be brought forward Early development larger Miller Bruce oil fields might also be encouraged he Lewis Davies measure might also aid offshore construction industry suffered huge amount lay offs under price slump more than pct year He pointed out relief only applies to development new fields outside Southern Basin means more jobs could be created as fields central northern sectors North Sea deeper than south thus greater capital labour requirements as waters deeper than south He PRT relief certain research expenditure help fundamental research oil industry although benefits research be seen several year

text.title: ANALYSTS SEE EARLY ONE POINT CUT IN U K BASE RATE
text.body: British bank base lending rates likely to fall by as much as one full point to pct week following sharp three billion stg cut U K Central government borrowing target to four billion stg set today s budget bank analysts analysts described Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson s budget as cautious quality currency money markets already started to reward Sterling surged on foreign exchange markets money market interest rates moved sharply lower as news budget measures came through analysts Lloyds merchant bank chief economist Roger Bootle he expected base rates to be cut by one full point tomorrow This very much safety first budget order to get interest rates down he Bootle money markets almost entirely discounted such one point cut key three month interbank rate down to pct night be rather conservative banks to go half point cut now Midland Bank treasury economist David Simmonds he too expected base rates be full point lower by Friday but likely happen via two half point cuts This budget designed to please both markets electorate implications interest rates very favourable we could half point cut tomrorow another such cut before end week Simmonds Pointing to buoyant U K Retail data released yesterday he Lawson done well to resist pressures sharp cut income tax rates at expense lower borrowing target There no real need to boost private consumption he National Westminster Bank chief economist David Kern lower borrowing target set budget increased likelihood early one point base rate cut Kern budget to be analysed carefully particular to see how exactly Lawson planned to achieve sharper than expected borrowing target cut before one point base rate cut could be implemented But providing budget small print convincing and I suspect be entirely possible we see one point off base rates by end week Kern Bootle Lloyds expected base rate cut pave way early one point cut mortgage lending rates help achieve Lawson s lower than expected consumer price inflation target four pct at end he U K Base rates were cut week to pct pct after sustained pressure foreign exchange money government bonds gilts markets But building societies they cut lending rates until base rates fallen by one full point

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC DOLLAR VALUE APPROPRI

text.title: DOLLAR VALUE APPROPRIATE BUNDESBANK OFFICIAL SAYS
text.body: The dollar near appropriate levels against European currencies yen further fall could damage confidence currency while endangering world economic growth top Bundesbank official Board member Leonhard Gleske also told Forex Association conference current exchange rates major currencies can be viewed as equilibrium levels medium term perspective He recent Paris agreement on currency stabilisation policy coordination between Group Five Canada may herald an era greater exchange rate stability Paris agreement however attempt to set up permanent target zones exchange rates Gleske stressed adding such targets be extremely difficult to agree enforce on international level At present levels dollar can no longer be considered grossly overvalued relation to European currencies yen Gleske He dollar fallen much less against currencies important trading nations such as Canada Korea Taiwan Hong Kong further falls there may still be necessary But a further dollar depreciation against major European currencies yen may be best way to restore dollar to fully competitive position as measured by weighted external value he fact further marked decline dollar rate hold two major dangers Gleske First countries large balance payments surpluses such as Japan West Germany threatened to hamper economic growth thus slow down expansion real income domestic expenditure necessary to wipe out surpluses Second United States could damage investors confidence dollar thus reduce their willingness to finance huge fiscal external payments deficits Gleske Gleske also strongly sceptical international system binding target zones currencies fluctuating narrow bands against each other can be established Such targets threatened to cause policy conflicts both within countries between them instance U S Reliance on foreign capital to fund deficits requires interest rates there be set at high levels but domestic considerations call low ones If target zones were established put pressure on other countries to reduce their interest rates even more even though may be conflict their own domestic situation priorities he Gleske added targeting exchange rate even within wide margin meet serious objections where there clearly perceived potential conflict between domestic external policy priorities Commenting on Paris currency accord Gleske chances stabilising exchange rates rested heavily on current interest rate differentials being maintained These chances seem to me to rest critically on expectation current configuration interest rates monetary policies behind them assure smooth financing current account imbalances months ahead Gleske past experience currency adjustments learned that markets inclined to be impatient thus tend to overshoot He would seem to be unnecessary should be avoided if at all possible Monetary policies can help achieve but only if markets believe pledged changes fiscal policies lead to balanced international payments he

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC U K BUDGET SEEN BOOS

text.title: U K BUDGET SEEN BOOSTING GOVERNMENT BOND MARKET
text.author: By Norma Cohen Reuters
text.body: Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson s budget contained virtually everything government bond gilts market hoped likely to help prices race ahead coming months analysts traders Indeed first half hour after Lawson completed his speech gilt prices soared points extremely sharp gain such short period time Overall they rose two points on day This budget incredibly bullish gilts market Morgan Grenfell Co Ltd economist Stephen Bell Analysts light reaction to budget gilts U K Money markets U K Commercial bank base rates likely to be cut by as much as full point tomorrow Analysts market s euphoria simply reflection supply demand crucial piece news budget Public Sector Borrowing Requirement be held to billion stg By comparison year ago PSBR set at billion stg lower PSBR means Bank England to offer far less new stock to market to meet funding needs scarcity factor sure to drive prices up further analysts The PSBR at four billion lower than anyone realistically expected Bell Most market expectations called Chancellor to announce PSBR billion stg S G Warburg Securities Co Ltd economist John Shepherd overall Bank to sell two billion less new securities next fiscal year cut pct total new issue volume Chase Manhattan Securities Ltd international economist Andy Wrobleski noted Bank already raised billion stg next year s funding needs year via series tap issues issues been partly paid form where full price does to be paid until start new fiscal year therefore they counted current year s fund raising But Bank England also be constrained issuing gilts conventional form by promise to try out U S style auction system firms bid new stock Bank also to offer at least one index linked issue where rate paid to investors tied to Retail Price Index leaving one to two billion stg total to be raised form traditional stock Analysts noted budget contains provision two pence pound cut basic rate income tax line most market expectations although some operators expected cut up to four pence pound gilts market approved more modest tax cut Shepherd because If more than two pct they become concerned economy heating up again Also cut two pence pound suggests if ruling Conservative party re elected another two pence cut can be offered at budget time next year Analysts gilts market may also be building steam on political implications budget suggests early election All goodies budget be place by middle May Morgan Grenfell s Bell This makes June election very likely Bell some politically popular provisions omitted budget such as lifting ceiling on amount mortgage eligible tax benefit some provisions on pensions could been implemented until autumn anyway At rate they been little use political party expecting to call election June Also analysts noted budget does go overboard measures seen as generous to wealthy This be difficult budget opposition Labour party to attack Shepherd

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC ANALYSTS SAY U K BUD

text.title: ANALYSTS SAY U K BUDGET POINTS TO BASE RATE CUTS
text.author: By Simon Cox Reuters
text.body: Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson s Budget speech described as sound well balanced by analysts if slightly lacking excitement cut bank base lending rates now widely expected tomorrow most forecasts predicting half point fall follow up half point cut anticipated next week Worthy but boring probably sum up Peter Fellner U K Economist at stockbrokers James Capel Co It very very prudent fiscal budget Richard Jeffrey brokers Hoare Govett well balanced budget within confines government s philosophy keeping expenditure levels flat Most analysts Budget very sound on fiscal side but offered nothing new on monetary policy As widely expected Lawson split his fiscal adjustment between trimming PSBR target to billion stg billion cutting basic rate income tax to pct target narrow measure money supply M kept unchangd at two to six pct while target broad Sterling M aggregate dropped Both Jeffrey Fellner budget clears way half point fall U K Base rates tomorrow but authorities unlikely to sanction larger cut immediately Many analysts currency dealers forecast full one point cut tomorrow The Bank England be loathe to take any action to reverse later Jeffrey though he added further half point cut quite possible near future main worry today s speech outlook inflation given signs relaxed monetary policy contained Scrimgeour Vickers economist Richard Holt Holt noted rather loose inflation forecast pct at end lower interest rates likely to result tough fiscal stance could cause longer term concern A higher PSBR target could be preferable long term he although lower mortgage interest rates on back falling base rates offsetting impact on inflation Budget inspire lot short term confidence but not good budget inflation he Jeffrey he liked Lawson to say more dangers excessive liquidity build up but overall too concerned revival inflation Fellner noted exchange rate to remain leading edge monetary policy but authorities were likely to be extremely cautious on front He they were unlikely to hesitate holding interest rates steady or even raising them again if sterling showed any signs excessive weakness Most analysts agreed Lawson bolstered credibility Budget by adopting realistic forecasts Raising forecast current account deficit to billion stg unsettle markets already discounting amount Jeffrey billion stg PSBR target given credibility by favourable outturn now also forecast to be billion stg But analysts Budget speech did give any clear cut indication timing general election to be held before June Some believe signals poll June noting benefits such as income tax cuts decision to raise duties on alcohol tobacco become available immediately But others kept several options open possible to deduce too much James Capel s Fellner noted by being fiscally prudent Lawson kept open possibility autumn election there be no chickens coming home to roost Richard Jeffrey who favours likelihood June election important Chancellor gone Budget aimed overtly at buying election victory Nevertheless he likely to result boost to Conservative Party s pre election popularity

responded proposal be submitted to board directors but no decisions yet been made on sale company Someone s betting company go dlrs per share one arbitrager Arbitragers stock risky buy at current levels unless offer accepted dlr per share range They to make arbitrage investment at level be chancy since take long time any transaction to be completed because regulatory approvals necessary broadcast properites Taft earlier rejected dlr per share or billion dlr bid investment group company rejected bid as inadequate based on advice Goldman Sachs Co financial adviser consider alternatives such as restructuring Arbitragers speculated bidding war may erupt Taft two large shareholders investment group led by Robert Bass Carl Lindner chairman American Financial Corp Bass group holds pct Taft Lindner holds pct Taft family founded company almost years ago pct Lindner week told Securities Exchange Commission he may be interested making bid Taft I could see if things got really crazy might go dlrs per share one arbitrager but he speculated probably even be taken over more than price s Another speculated Lindner might bid but he speculated investor really be interested running company Lindner unavailable comment Dennis McAlpine analyst Oppenheimer Co he speculated company might be considering leveraged buyout Ideally you d to break thing up to satisfy all interests involved he adding two largest shareholders might be interested pieces Taft He highest takeover price he calculated company been dlrs per share but highest estimates on Wall Street been He latter be based on more optimistic expectations broadcast industry

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC BUDGET SEEN PAVING WA

text.title: BUDGET SEEN PAVING WAY FOR EARLY U K ELECTION
text.author: By Sten Stovall Reuters
text.body: The budget presented by Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson described by MPs analysts as being politically astute combining tax cuts fiscal prudence promised to boost Conservative government s standing both voters financial markets budget contained two penny cut standard rate tax three billion stg reduction Public Sector Borrowing Requirement PSBR to billion stg Parliamentarians budget pave way fall domestic interest rates early election Conservative MP Anthony Beaumont Dark budget is glamourous but sound sensible Lawson told journalists later a budget built on success success But opposition MPs did agree David Steel leader Liberal Party this strangely deceptive budget Chancellor six billion stg to give back he chosen to give half to reducing PSBR whereas we SDP Liberal Aliance think been wiser to use those revenues to reduce unemployment alleviate poverty Steel the cunning thing seductive budget all good things come pre election period fall interest rates fall mortgage rates lower income tax relatively cheaper whisky beer cigarettes petrol David Owen leader Social Democratic Party SDP Liberals make up centrist Alliance grouping this good attempt at electioneering budget but failed objective given money to haves as opposed to have nots Labour leader Neil Kinnock called a bribes budget Kinnock budget had little to do general good everything to do general election Roy Hattersley Labour Party s Treasury spokesman the Tories should used available resources to invest industry health education He added we know whoever elected to power next general election reverse these tax cuts But Lawson rejected Rather he Treasury expected to at least billion stg fiscal use cutting taxes or raising public spending Lawson rejected claims by opposition MPs government be forced to call election by deteriorating economy his financial statement to Parliament Lawson the setting year s budget more favourable than been many years We now entering our seventh year steady growth fifth been combined low inflation public finances sound strong unemployment falling He these fruits government s determination bad times as well as good to hold firmly to our policies sound money free markets Lawson later Government felt no compulsion to plump early election Asked by political journalists what effect Budget on election timing he replied I think we hold election either late or early I must confess I am rather relaxed all There any compulsion to go early election But he added if Prime Minister decides to go early election bring to end all rather ridiculous pre election atmosphere fever there something to be Industry also welcomed Lawson s budget Confederation British Industry CBI President David Nickson This budget reinforce business success Lower government borrowing means lower interst rates business what CBI wanted We always we judge budget on how affects cost borrowing should do trick

reuters.unknown: F A RM f reute r f BC U S HOUSING DATA FAI

text.title: U S HOUSING DATA FAIL TO CLARIFY ECONOMIC PATH
text.author: By Claire Miller Reuters
text.body: Surprisingly strong U S housing statistics February cannot be taken as indication economy generating any momentum sufficient cause to start lifting forecasts first quarter growth economists Building boosted by two factors month unusually mild weather low mortgage rates But economists seasonal factors make hard to assess what spur to economy if any come housing coming months after steady retreat mortgage rates seem to be near bottom U S housing starts rose pct February to seasonally adjusted annual rate units January highest pace starts since April rate at permits were issued future building climbed pct to seasonally adjusted annual rate units after dropping pct to January February s weather usually more adverse home building Because seasonal factors s difficult to determine what means economy down road Allan Leslie Discount Corp housing report seasonally weighted to compensate weather related setbacks As result milder temperatures inflate statistics Economists low mortgage rates also were spur to building month But several believe rates now consolidate before edging up late spring early summer Builders looking at current mortgage rates saying Let s do now Mark Obrinsky U S League Savings Institutions Washington whose members supply much financing home building But Obrinsky doubts there much more downward potential rates because he foresees higher inflation some overall improvement U S economy He expects rates to gain to basis points early summer pct fixed rate effective February November fixed rate mortgages were pct As expected strength housing concentrated single family sector multi family area typically represents rental units remained weak due to high vacancy rates increased capital costs such units following tax law changes effective January Single family starts rose at pct annual pace to units Multi family fell pct to rate Strength single family sector indicates low mortgage rates doing their job But we re probably looking at great deal growth potential Ward McCarthy Merrill Lynch Capital Markets McCarthy noted housing report together larger than expected gains U S employment industrial output retail sales February may cause some observers to start waving four pct GNP banners first quarter Gross national product grew pct fourth quarter But McCarthy who still expects first quarter real GNP to come at annual rate pct or slightly above convinced growth pick up future The big story inventory re building s going on now all intentional he example U S automakers who already saddled high stocks produced at annual rate units February compared domestic car sales Thus while inventories could contribute to GNP first quarter they may result scaled back production weaker growth second he If most first quarter growth inventory building we cannot identify any improvement export demand then there potential softness second quarter agreed Allan Leslie Discount Corp He still evaluating first quarter GNP prospects Federal Reserve chairman Paul Volcker week current data do show worsening trade reversed At same time we pumping up inventories first quarter we could foresee production slowing second cautioned Joe Plocek McCarthy Crisanti Maffei Inc who expects first quarter growth three pct

reuters.unknown: C G f reute u f BC U S HOUSE APPROVES

text.title: U S HOUSE APPROVES PILOT DISASTER PROGRAM
text.body: The House Representatives approved bill to enable winter wheat feedgrains farmers hit by midwestern flooding year to receive at least pct their federal income support payments even if they did plant one time pilot program designed to assist farmers Kansas Oklahoma Michigan parts Missouri passed by vote sent to Senate Although bill includes narrow version provision endorsed by Reagan administration U S Agriculture Department withheld support measure USDA bill discourage farmers buying crop insurance fall short administration s proposed broad scale revision farm programs bill permit winter wheat producers prevented planting their crop fall to receive pct deficiency payments they received To be eligible winter wheat farmers could plant different crop on land spring although they could use land grazing or to plant hay USDA estimated provision save dlrs largely because reduced crop forfeitures bill also aid feedgrains producers along Missouri Mississippi Rivers who were prevented planting crops year because residual damage fall s flooding addition measure require USDA to make full payment to farmers eligible emergency assistance approved by Congress fall Currently because claims outstripped dlrs appropriated funds USDA plans to offer farmers region cents every dollar disaster losses administration opposed bill because by expanding dlrs disaster relief thwart efforts to encourage farmers to buy crop insurance as alternative to federal disaster assistance USDA also provisions bill were narrower than administration s proposal to offer option to all major commodities produce insignificant savings USDA option winter wheat farmers produce net savings dlrs while requirement to compensate fully disaster struck farmers cost dlrs must be appropriated by Congress feedgrains provision cost five dlrs USDA estimated overall cost bill to be dlrs January Senate approved bill make winter wheat farmers eligible disaster assistance payments But Senate bill offer option to wheat feedgrains producers or raise mln dlr ceiling on disaster assistance program

text.title: BRAZILIAN PLANNING MINISTER RESIGNS
text.body: Brazilian Planning Minister Joao Sayad resigned presidential spokesman His resignation accepted during meeting President Jose Sarney afternoon spokesman No official reasons resignation were immediately available but sources close to government Sayad pressed three month price freeze sharp government spending cuts to combat inflation Neither Sarney nor Finance Minister Dilson Funaro accepted proposals sources Sayad one architects year s Plano Cruzado program froze prices ended widespread indexation economy introduced new cruzado currency to replace cruzeiro bid to cut pct annual inflation rate After holding prices nearly nine months plan unable to withstand inflationary pressures booming consumer demand widespread shortages first two months year prices rose by around per cent sharp deterioration Brazil s foreign trade surplus caused President Sarney to announce month suspension interest rate payments on billion dollars commercial debt Finance Minister Funaro told reporters week new measures to correct economy be announced within month although he gave no further details Earlier today U S Treasury secretary James Baker Brazil should come up new economic plan if hopes to get additional assistance commercial banks others Sayad s resignation might foreshadow other changes Brazilian cabinet Presidential spokesman Frota Netto told journalists earlier today government considering suggestion by Chief Civilian Staff at Presidency Marco Maciel new multi party cabinet be formed to deal country s current economic difficulties

reuters.unknown: F f reute r f BC STOCKS VOTE

text.title: U S OTC MARKET PROPOSES ONE SHARE ONE VOTE
text.author: By Judith Crosson Reuters
text.body: The National Association Securities Dealers all stock exchanges should require listed companies adopt one share one vote rule but few exceptions letter to Securities Exchange Commission NASD President Gordon Macklin group be happy to be first exchange to adopt uniform rule but certain exceptions Clearly NASD willingly be first to do so If voluntary private sector resolution practical then commission should adopt rule to apply to all markets NASD NASD study found percent companies OTC offered only one class stock NASD proposal calls all stock markets to uniform rule emphasize principle equal voting rights but allow legitimate variations NASD allow companies to issue shares do voting rights as long as limitation clearly spelled out to investors wants to prevent listed companies turning voting shares into non voting shares without shareholder approval Parrillo A uniform rule should be written to cure what been construed by some to be abusive practice involving use stock other than full voting rights association statement Exceptions include shares registerd public offering where all facts connected company s capital structure clearly spelled out prospectus shares issued connection merger acquisition or recapitalization where exchange shares accompanied by detailed proxy material NYSE rule allow companies to dual class stock only if majority publicly held shares majority independent directors on board approve move NYSE allowed few listed companies dual classes to continue trading pending approval SEC NASD specifically wants to disallow issuance dual class shares where those superior voting rights resalable Parillo such provision effect prevent firm ever being purchased by anyone else

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT JAPAN BUYING OVERSEAS FIRMS
text.author: By JEFF STEARNS REUTERS
text.body: More U S European firms be falling prey to Japanese corporations bulging cash eager to extend their reach further overseas according to merger acquisitions specialists polled by Reuters Already rich Japanese companies pounced on U S Banks steel other businesses latest attempt Fujitsu Ltd ITSU T Japan s biggest computer maker unsuccessfully bid Fairchild Semiconductor Corp U S Microchip maker supplies components supercomputers Nomura Securities Co Ltd NMSC T Daiwa Securities Co Ltd DSEC T Japan s two largest brokerage firms seeking niche U S European securities markets while country s huge banks looking strongholds overseas banking takeover specialists Major trading houses see their profits evaporating heat increased competition merchandise trade all foreign businesses on their shopping lists Among manufacturers car parts makers under most pressure to buy up overseas companies follow big auto makers they subcontract as these move offshore The timing favourable Japanese parties to buy up potential overseas businesses especially U S Japan s largest market where political risks minimal takeover specialist at one trading company Japanese companies become among world s richest after series boom export years as yen climbed against dollar by some pct past months But yen s strength also raised costs Japan s exports allowed Asian neighbours to move into traditional markets frozen Japanese corporate growth specialists Looming trade friction also threatening to erect more barriers against Japanese exports Japanese firms see overseas acquisitions as way to avoid gloomy growth outlook put their excess cash to work Domestic interest rates now at record lows offer little investment opportunity Japanese interest acquisitions been continuous but recent economic factors become driving force banking industry source So far though Japanese being cautious While mergers acquisitions among U S Firms number thousands Japanese buyouts overseas companies totalled just few dozen one merchant banker Another merchant banker flurry Japanese acquisition activity originally expected five years now but time span appeared now to be too long Japanese firms becoming more aggressive now he turning point seemed to be Dainippon Ink Chemicals Inc s DIAC T takeover bid Sun Chemical Corp U S year some analysts saw as somewhat hostile he added Dainippon Ink bought Sun Chemical s graphic arts group dlrs late year after earlier unsolicited bid whole company Sun Chemical refused to sell entire business after learning Dainippon planned to liquidate all but graphic arts related businesses Hostile takeovers considered unethical frowned upon by Japanese trading company official says Japanese people don t like fighting They prefer peaceful amicable deals But now after some experience overseas Japanese companies acquainted local practice he adds This healthy progression However experts do expect Japanese to run board meetings any giant U S Or European concerns Japanese companies fully confident managing large U S Or European corporation one banker They expand their operations only gradually typical way Japanese business foreign merchant banker also noted There many mega deals left to do United States lot big deals there already been done But medium size small concerns potential targets Japanese companies specialists Japanese be aiming new businesses high technology areas Japanese companies used technology quality to get where they unlikely to deviate trend one takeover specialist Many watching results first acquisitions If these succeed activity could build specialists But few such specialists going to sit back wait until action begins Already they Japanese trading houses long term credit commercial banks brokerages foreign merchant banks set up research sections to act as go betweens deals or find good buys themselves

text.title: THAI BANKS WEIGH NEW INTEREST RATE CUT
text.author: By Vithoon Amorn Reuters
text.body: Officials five Thai commercial banks expected to meet tomorrow to seek agreement on cutting interest rates banking sources They they expect Thai banks to opt cut to spur domestic loan demand to help reduce persistent high liquidity on money market Many bankers been urging average half percentage point cut deposit rates one point cut lending rates they Six major Thai major banks reduced minimum loan overdraft rates by to percentage point on February but move substantially increased loan demand sources Excess liquidity been hitting bank profits since early year despite five interest rate cuts current gross pct interest rate one year fixed bank deposit pct minimum loan rate lowest decade Bankers Thai banking system saddled to billion baht surplus funds created problems many banks managing their money effectively Profits many Thai banks fell sharply year partly because mismatch loan demand bank deposit growth Bank Thailand estimated overall lending by Thai banking system grew pct against pct expansion bank deposits Reports possible new round interest rate cuts further buoyed Thai stock market week Securities Exchange Thailand SET Index on Monday recorded biggest daily advance recent years shooting up points to new seven year high Brokers market analysts Thai stocks register more gains as long as liquidity remains money market Thai foreign bankers liquidity problem grow if Bank Thailand does extend permission local banks to hold foreign exchange positions up to pct bank capital If regulation extended beyond April expiry date many commercial banks to reduce foreign exchange holdings to maximum pct Bankers such could add another five billion baht surplus funds to local money market

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC ZAIRE AND IMF IN ECON

text.title: ZAIRE AND IMF IN ECONOMIC RESCUE TALKS
text.author: By Jean Loup Fievet Reuters
text.body: Talks underway between financially troubled Zaire International Monetary Fund IMF aimed at rescuing economy second largest nation sub Saharan Africa Diplomatic banking sources Kinshasa agreed compromise formula could be reached coming weeks enabling pro Western Zaire to obtain much needed injection cash part government expected to increase budgetary discipline turn likely to attract foreign investors sources Barring ditch obstacles can t be totally ruled out issue involving nation s pride substantial political economic interests Zaire creditors bound to come to terms soon Western diplomat told Reuters The Zairean economy won t survive without massive IMF assistance Similarily West no interest to see Zaire s strategic minerals fall into communist hands diplomat Zaire defied creditors late year by saying limit repayments on five billion dlr external debt to pct export earnings January government also announced end to floating exchange rate zaire currency return to fixed parity against special drawing rights SDRs periodic adjustments Until year Zaire devoted up to pct export revenue to servicing large foreign debts contracted during copper boom s to finance largely non productive often extravagant investment projects Zaire world s leading cobalt producer sixth largest supplier copper depends on two minerals two thirds export earnings A young country cannot go on indefinitely sacrificing everything sake servicing external debt President Mobutu Sese Seko commented October when he announced his government s decision As early as January Mobutu warned one does feed on austerity praise I another debt one toward my people my people s efforts must backfire he told diplomats Zaire pointed out during four years IMF backed austerity become net exporter capital without receiving appropriate financing abroad Economists since large devaluation zaire currency September country suffered net outflow dlrs each year Zaire s medium long term public debt past few years reached equivalent pct Gross National Product GNP one highest such ratios world banking sources Mobutu accused IMF strangling his country at October meeting ruling MPR party his people could long endure hardship caused by austerity Zairean officials blame their present difficulties on IMF recovery plan s two basic assumptions they failed to materialise year world economic recovery pushing up commodity prices boosting Zaire s export revenue debt servicing capacity substantial additional financial help country s traditional donors Zaire set out on major economic reform aimed at curbing soaring debt floated currency slashed spending privatised industry gaining praise Western creditors obtaining debt rescheduling As result overall economic financial situation improved markedly inflation down to pct year pct But also led to severe steady fall living standards Zaire s population fuelling widespread discontent among poorer city dwellers diplomats Economists estimate drop purchasing power at between pct average household over months despite pay rise up to pct civil servants announced May World Bank released two months half previously agreed dlrs industrial sector loan lent dlrs to modernise country s vital river transport system Belgium Zaire s former colonial ruler main trading partner recently agreed to release total dlrs to ease payments difficulties finance imports spare parts industry new agreement between IMF Zaire pave way another debt rescheduling probably at next meeting Paris Club Western creditor nations diplomats

text.title: LAWSON HAPPY WITH STERLING BACKS LATEST RATE CUT
text.author: By Sten Stovall Reuters
text.body: Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson he content current level sterling welcomed today s announcement further half point cut British bank base lending rates to pct However he he wanted to see gradual approach to declines domestic U K Interest rates although optimism financial markets might push big moves quickly He told briefing economic journalists I don t think we should rush anything Lawson stressed themes gradualism steadiness as economic policy Lawson acknowledged today s fall interest rates were response to his budget fiscal unveiled yesterday to Parliament set lower target key Public Sector Borrowing Requirement PSBR pct GDP Lawson two recent cuts base rates both made month form half percentage point declines were perfectly consistent monetary conditions now Britain He supported by saying narrow M money supply aggregate safely inside flucuation band two to six pct set both his budget Lawson set no explicit target range broader sterling M Turning to question Britain eventually joining exchange rate mechanism European Monetary System EMS Lawson repeated it most unlikely we enter before next election He Britain keeping subject full EMS membership under constant review But he indicate what chief considerations were government Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher late year decision on whether or to join depended on strength U K Economy But she later such move depended on other EMS countries scrapping residual capital controls Although Lawson denounced what he the current wave election fever Britain he added It more likely there be election year than He he supported early election only because clear air Ideally we the government should full term but events could force premature poll Lawson government been power since must call election by June Speculation rising either June or early autumn election political sources decision to cut basic tax by only two pence was right balance economically politically he Lawson s decision to restrict fall standard rate tax to two pence surprised many analysts who predicted Treasurys coffers full tax revenue allowed government to reach goal pct one move But being praised today by political analysts as shrewd move while advancing towards aim could be seized upon by opposition parties as overtly trying to bribe electorate Lawson told journalists he been surprised by how much PSBR undershot his original assumption billion stg by some three billion stg Returning to changing levels interest rates Lawson stressed they objective for government they instrument policy Consequently Treasury no precise target domestic borrowing levels he But there may be interest rate consequences changes level government borrowing he added Lawson he did think U K s relatively high level real interest rates hurt investment Britain He conditions created by London s role as leading financial centre caused sterling interest rates to be higher real terms than other countries Three factors caused higher level relative interest rates Britain Lawson First control credit Britain rested on interest rates alone due to freedom financial markets He second reason political uncertainty caused by proposed spending plans opposition Labour Party Thirdly he we do as long track record low inflation as did U S Japan West Germany Lawson foresaw London becoming world s pre eminent financial centre because more international character more favourably placed time zones than New York or Tokyo

well above three to six pct target zone so change credit policies could be ruled out One money market dealer comments by Bundesbank President Karl Otto Poehl at private seminar Duesseldorf two weeks ago hinting at another interest rate cut only indicated Bundesbank might act if conditions changed Bank economists U S Pressure on West Germany to further ease credit policies receded since Paris pact But such demands could re emerge if West Germany failed to stimulate economy enough to affect massive U S Trade deficit Remsperger continued strong money supply growth also precluded further cut domestic credit demand likely to remain at steady levels money stock growth expected to narrow medium term These developments were increasing Bundesbank s scope rate cut medium term economists Money market dealers period rates remained little changed indicating no change credit policy expected Call money rates declined to pct yesterday market well stocked liquidity Dealers call money soft because text.title: CATTLE BEING PLACED ON FEED LIGHTER THAN NORMAL
text.author: By Jerry Bieszk Reuter
text.body: Most cattle now being placed on U S feedlots weigh less than normal likely remain on feed longer spreading out marketings supporting cattle prices through summer because reduced beef supply prospect so many cattle remaining on feed longer time blunted market impact high placements reported USDA s latest cattle on feed report livestock analysts After USDA released report cattle on feed seven states as March cattle futures on Chicago Mercantile Exchange yesterday rose sharply trade expected deferred contracts to decline on USDA report pct rise cattle placements February year ago Although heavy placements were expected analysts noted reports many cattle put on feed were relatively lightweight feedlot operators feed lighter cattle into autumn rather than market them during summer as be case heavier cattle normally placed on feed Although reports actual cattle weights difficult to obtain industry sources West Southwest acknowledge lighter cattle being put on feedlots their areas increase lighter weight cattle entering feedlots helps explain jump feedlot placements month February University Missouri Agricultural Economist Glenn Grimes The probabilities high order to place many cattle on feed they feedlot operators to go to lighter weight cattle only statistics available some terminal markets represent only small percentage total cattle marketed But at those markets steers averaged lbs February compared lbs year Grimes Even if marketing lighter cattle delayed Grimes beef supply likely be reduced If average weight down there no price weakness to delay marketings cattle be marketed at lighter weights could reduce beef supply as much as three pct Bruce Ginn cattle analyst Helming Group formerly LBAS lighter cattle being placed on feed mainly because two factors low grain prices higher live cattle prices Many farmers like to feed lighter weight cattle grain supplies large he noted Also higher live cattle prices been encouraging early movement cattle wheat pasture onto feedlots Ginn Other analysts also noted cattle coming off wheat pasture sooner than normal because poor pasture conditions Gary Chapmann cash livestock trader Chapmann Graham Sioux City Iowa he believed general trend to lighter weight placements but pasture conditions his area benefited dry mild winter To south however he weather wetter some cattle coming off pasture weighing to lbs less than normal after having gained only lbs all winter

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC U K BASE RATES WILL

text.title: U K BASE RATES WILL FALL AGAIN SOON SAY ANALYSTS
text.author: By Geert Linnebank Reuters
text.body: Today s modest half point cut U K Bank base lending rates to pct signals Bank England s determination to maintain cautious monetary stance but financial markets appear set to force hand analysts They further half point cut base rates to pct bound to occur within next week rates may shed further half point soon if markets remain buoyant Earlier markets were bracing one point cut rates after yesterday s budget set sharp three billion stg reduction government borrowing targets to four billion stg Sterling money market rates moved lower again key three month interbank rate down to pct at start business yesterday sterling rallied to four year highs against dollar very active trading Government bond prices also surged on budget gains excess one point pushing yields on long term paper below nine pct first time nearly year But today s smaller than expected rate cut appeared to placated markets now analysts Money market rates recovered up to point earlier lows while both sterling gilts came off highs as trading ground to near halt Analysts slowdown likely to be temporary reappraisal sterling assets by international investors set to resume as early as tomorrow leading to higher gilt prices exchange rate advances lower money market rates Today s cut slightly disappointing Bill Martin chief U K Economist at stockbrokers Phillips Drew The Bank England taking very cautious line To temper markets first rush blood to head after budget Analysts bank s move today to lend two week cash to U K Discount houses at lower pct suggested hoped to maintain new rates period time analysts agreed success depend largely on how sterling performs near term Sharp rises pound s value could be checked initially through Bank England intervention but eventually gains force bank to cut interest rates rates again The market seems to accepted modest cut time being Midland Bank treasury economist David Simmonds But I am sceptical bank be able to hold up rates long Simmonds he saw sterling rising another two U S Cents week around dlrs forcing rate cut by Friday Robin Marshall chief economist at Chase Manhattan Securities There another half point to come near term week or next week at latest We see whole point off base rates next two or three weeks Analysts stressed apart prestige Britain very little to gain sharp rise sterling s exchange rate Martin Phillips Drew dampening effect sterling rise on consumer price inflation materialise at least nine months while hampering impact on manufactured exports show almost immediately Analysts budget featuring income tax cuts as well as cautious plans public finances improved chances re election Conservative government probably advanced election date One must be held before June Combined overall good prospects U K Economy likely to fuel foreign rush on sterling denominated assets pushing pound s value well above unofficial targets mark denominated investments largely out favour because low yields dull economic outlook Chase s Marshall Sterling simply best game town especially after budget demand remain strong

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT JAPAN SHIPBUILDERS RECOVERY
text.author: By Fumiko Fujisaki Reuters
text.body: Japan s ailing shipbuilding industry plans to refloat itself few years twin rocks recession strong yen through capacity workforce cuts greater use computers industry sources told Reuters salvage measures include government sponsored rationalisation program aimed at clawing back some market Japan world leader lost to South Korea through currency labour cost disadvantages they sources South Korea s yards now some pct more competitive than Japan s due to such factors government plans to help industry shed pct current capacity within two years through mergers regrouping under legislation put before Parliament month likely to be approved by May or June sources They September semi government body assure repayment billion yen liabilities incurred through job losses sale excess capacity another billion buying unneeded land equipment Friday Shipbuilders Association Japan applied to Fair Trade Commission to form cartel to slash tonnage built to half total capacity year April commission held several hearings industry approval should be given month sources clampdown on output over one or two years combined planned cost cutting streamlining program state support should help Japanese yards recover their international competitiveness they Under cartel proposals yards each capable building ships more than gross tonnes build maximum three compensated gross registered tonnes CGRT half total capacity ease cut throat competition forced most yards to sign orders below cost sources industry likely to seek to renew cartel as Transport Ministry sees new orders falling to CGRT they rationalisation program includes cut to estimated workers industry between Japanese yards topped world order books at end December followed by South Korea Taiwan according to Lloyd s Register Shipping However falling orders declining international competitiveness due to strong yen led to heavy losses industry sources Four Japan s six major heavy machinery shipbuilding companies reported current deficits first half year to March five them expected to report current deficits whole they shipbuilding companies streamlining program raise productivity to compete South Korean yards also been hard hit by declining orders low ship prices recnt years sources Japan no single yard leads industry resulting fierce competition slow progress reducing capacity two largest firms Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd MITH T Ishikawajima Harima Heavy Industries Co Ltd JIMA T account only pct ships built sources World shipowners hope Japanese yards can manage to ride out recession as their technology best world official at major Japanese shipping company Japanese merchant fleet largest after Liberia s no intention shifting to other countries to buy ships encourage Japanese yards reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC SPANISH POWER COMPANY

text.title: SPANISH POWER COMPANY FECSA MAY SUSPEND PAYMENTS
text.author: By Jules Stewart Reuters
text.body: Spain s financially troubled power company Fuerzas Electricas de Cataluna S A FECSA may suspend payments if fails to reach agreement creditors on renegotiating billion peseta debt company official We only take step event lack co operation on part our creditors FECSA assistant general manager Jose Zaforteza told Reuters telephone interview It unlikely they refuse to renegotiate He creditors obtain better deal by negotiating than under suspension payments FECSA scheduled to begin formal talks creditors on April foreign banks holding some billion pesetas debt they were angered over what they called lack information on company s situation spokesman one U S Bank creditor reply to inquiries It been two months since we first detected signs serious trouble at FECSA we still no idea how company plans to restructure finances spokesman no foreign bankers been notified when FECSA yesterday action unrelated to possible total payments suspension suspended payment on debt principal FECSA s Zaforteza however telexes been sent to creditors notifying them move he unavoidable He decision did affect payment interest on loans debentures FECSA faces repayment billion pesetas interest billion on principal year U S Bank spokesman foreign banks were now more dark than ever FECSA called renegotiating debt when Madrid stock exchange on February suspended trading shares move officials meant to protect shareholders Zaforteza company ask creditors to switch old debt to new loans at lower interest rates postpone interest payments possibly convert some debt into shares Foreign bankers they assumed government involved control management electricity sector They added lending policy toward industry could be affected if banks lost money FECSA Foreign banking sources they considered likely fresh postponement billion peseta Chase Manhattan Bank CMB N led syndicated loan to power company Hidrolectrica de Cataluna S A Hidruna facility scheduled to be signed mid February but postponed when bourse suspended FECSA s shares We planned to sign month but looks unlikely under present circumstances foreign banker

text.title: U S CORN MARKET SKEWED BY SOVIET BUYING
text.author: By Andrew Stern Reuters
text.body: Recent purchases U S corn by Soviet Union skewed domestic cash market by increasing price difference between premium price paid at Gulf export point interior levels cash grain dealers Many dealers expect USDA act soon to reduce cash price premium at Gulf versus interior dealer Davenport Iowa roughly pct wider than normal time year at cents bushel by making worthwhile farmers to move grain By lowering ASCS county posted prices corn USDA could encourage farmers to engage PIK roll corn sales where PIK certificates used to redeem corn stored under government price support loan program then marketed If USDA acts soon as many dealers expect movement break Gulf corn basis The USDA been using Gulf price to determine county posted prices one dealer It should be taking average Gulf price price Kansas City more closely reflect lower prices interior Midwest But we don t know when they might do Ohio dealer created uncertainty market USDA started PIK certificate program effort to free up surplus grain otherwise be forfeited to government remain off market storage Yesterday USDA issued report showing only slightly more than pct billion dlrs PIK certificates issued to farmers in lieu cash payments to date been exchanged grain several billion dlrs worth additional PIK certificates scheduled to be issued coming months USDA be well advised to encourage exchange grain by adjusting ASCS prices cash grain dealers byproduct Soviet buying been sharp rise barge freight costs quoted carrying grain Midwest to export terminals cash dealers Freight upper areas Mississippi risen nearly pct past two weeks to over pct original tariff price mild winter early reopening mid Mississippi river spring also encouraged firmer trend barge freight dealers noted higher transportation costs served to depress interior corn basis levels squeezing margins obtained by elevators feeding Gulf export market as well as discouraging farmer marketings they The Gulf market overreacted to Soviet buying reports indicate USSR booked over two perhaps as much as tonnes U S corn one Midwest cash grain trader But dealers anticipate once rumors subside freight rates settle back down because overall surplus barges on Midwest river system

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC FRANCE ANNOUNCES PLAN

text.title: FRANCE ANNOUNCES PLAN TO BOOST EMPLOYMENT
text.body: The government announced three billion franc program to combat long term unemployment amid speculation among political economic analysts positioning itself period economic reflation package presented to cabinet Prime Minister Jacques Chirac by Social Affairs Labour Minister Philippe Seguin today to be financed out billion franc contingency fund announced on February Finance Minister Edouard Balladur previously ruled out reflationary program Long term unemployment defined as being out work more than one year affects people or one third French unemployed government figures show main measures employment program give employers financial incentives to offer short term work contracts at least two years stress retraining to help long term unemployed return to labour market Training subsidies exemptions social security contributions main incentives employers Companies tell us we to give them strong incentive to take on people who fallen out labour market s why proposals Are costly aide to Seguin analysts speculation government considering reflationary program sparked by Chirac spokesman Denis Baudouin who yesterday ministers were generally agreed on desirability relaunching economy He appeared to contradict statements by Balladur ruling out economic stimulation despite government s revision growth forecast to pct Finance ministry officials later clarified Baudouin s remarks saying there no question any move to stimulate economy through boost to consumer spending although government policy allowed increased industrial investment proceeds France s five year privatisation plan budget allowed billion francs revenue privatisation to be split between repaying national debt providing state enterprises fresh capital Some political analysts Baudouin s comments possibly reflect widening differences within RPR UDF coalition on social issues ahead next year s presidential elections Divisions began to show December when wave strikes led by transport workers paralysed country drove government into new mood conciliation labour Officials after success privatisation Cie de Saint Gobain SGEP PA Cie Financiere de Paribas PARI PA government decided to speed up five year privatisation program aim completing third year ahead presidential elections expected accelerated program could provide additional unbudgeted revenue to boost industrial research investment spending on infrastructure such as national motorway network government also today revived proposal blocked year by Socialist president Francois Mitterrand to encourage more flexible Omer will be difficult if impossible Sudan to pay scheduled billion dlrs principal interest payments over next five years He Sudan reached agreement Soviet Union East European allies to service half debts to them commodities rest hard currency Western diplomatic official sources Khartoum say pct Sudan s total foreign debt to Soviet Union Eastern bloc Arab countries Sudan to dlrs arrears to dlrs to service debts fiscal year ending next June Sudan Treasury depleted by nearly four years civil war south aftermath devastating drought budget deficit billion pounds fiscal year Diplomatic text.title: EC WARNS CONGRESS ON NEW TRADE BILL
text.author: By Robert Trautman
text.body: The European Community EC warned U S House Representatives tough trade legislation considering could prompt retaliation by U S trading partners warning sent letter Sir Roy Denman head EC delegation Washington to Dan Rostenkowski chairman House Ways Means Committee copy letter made available to Reuters Denman told Rostenkowski Illinois Democrat he backed aspects bill such as one backing new talks under GATT one excluding protection textile industry But Denman disagreed other provisions require President Reagan to take retaliatory trade action against nations large trade surpluses U S set new standards judging unfair foreign trade practices Denman told Rostenkowski GATT regulations prohibit member nations taking unilateral retaliatory action trade disputes unless action GATT approved He If Congress makes retaliatory action mandatory then United States be violation international legal obligations on collision course major trading partners Denman added president should flexibility enforcing trade laws saying in resort any administration must take decision light overall national interest Otherwise he the risk be counter reaction by trading partners United States i e retaliation or enactment mirror image legislation to be employed against imports United States Denman also Congress could prompt retaliation if reduced threshhold unfair trade by making easier firms to file unfair trade practice claims Retaliation could also be prompted by relaxing standards findings imports were injuring U S firms Changes these standards must be agreed upon multilaterally They cannot be imposed by United States alone on world trading system he House leaders rejected plan by textile state legislators to add to trade bill provision to curb imports cloth clothing similar to measure passed two years ago but vetoed by President Reagan There concern by leaders Reagan veto entire trade bill because textile amendment

reuters.unknown: F Y f reute r f BC ENERGY INDUSTRY IN BE

text.title: U S ENERGY INDUSTRY SAID IN BETTER HEALTH
text.author: By PETER ELSWORTH Reuters
text.body: The U S oil gas industry better health than year ago according to testimony given to Texas Railroad Commission at annual state industry hearing today Commission regulates state s oil gas industry heard testimony number high level company executives reflecting belief recent industry downturn bottomed out The attitude expressed here today so far great deal more optimistic than year Commissioner James E Jim Nugent told Reuters It reflects their the executives belief they seeing bottom economic cycle he added and just few reasonable breaks industry can begin to move again energy industry hard hit by sharp drop oil prices fell around dlrs barrel late to as low as dlrs mid Prices since steadied to around dlrs barrel At same time number company executives testified nation s domestic exploration production segment still hurting need government help Production costs considerably higher United States than such areas as Middle East as prices fell many domestic producers were forced to shut down their operations Currently there only oil rigs operating United States compared average nearly Citing study released yesterday by Department Energy many falling production domestic oil coupled increasing U S demand leading to growing dependency on imports particularly politically volatile Middle East In U S petroleum production responded to lower prices increasing pct or barrels per day bpd J S Simon General Manager Supply Department at Exxon Corp XON nation s largest oil company At same time Simon U S oil production declined by bpd first decline several years net petroleum imports were up pct to bpd Noting while oil prices were expected to remain between dlrs barrel depending on OPEC s ability to control production Simon demand expected to remain at levels leading to a significant amount spare worldwide production capacity excess bpd He surplus capacity lead to continued volatility called governmental regulatory policies support domestic petroleum industry Citing costs recently imposed by federal government through tax code changes Superfund legislation Simon called repeal windfall profits tax total decontrol natural gas improved access to federal lands oil gas exploration Simon did mention oil import fee many industry called as way building up nation s domestic operations before imports reach such level national security might be compromised yesterday s report Energy Department imports could make up pct U S demand by adding Persian Gulf producers provide as much as pct free world s total oil consumption by date Arguing oil political tool every nation on earth Frank Pitts chairman Pitts Oil Co today called variable oil import fee among other measures before treacherous foothold Middle East irreversible our national security compromised Royce Wisenbaker Chairman Wisenbaker Production Co agreed saying like many federal government programs were set up good intentions probably turn into shambles Wisenbaker added he optimistic future For those us who managed to hold on worst over he Roger Hemminghaus President Diamond Shamrock Refining Marketing Co he enthusiastic future adding he expected an increase profitability by midyear

reuters.unknown: C f reute r f BC TRIPLE WITCHING OVERH

text.title: TRIPLE WITCHING ISSUE OVERHANGS FUTURES MEETING
text.author: By Nelson Graves Reuters
text.body: Leaders major U S commodity exchanges their federal regulators begin three day meeting here tomorrow satisfied industry s growth but uncertain their futures estimated industry officials expected to attend annual gathering hosted by Futures Industry Association FIA satisfaction comes dramatic expansion U S futures options industries over decade uncertainty surrounding year s meeting stems largely pervasive sense potential major market disruption stalks futures options equity industries bucolic resort provide ironic backdrop as financial industry s chiefs anxiously observe quarter s triple witching hour March when price gyrations threaten to rock markets Triple witching occurs when stock index futures options individual stock options expire simultaneously quarterly phenomenon been marked by price volatility as arbitrageurs shifted investments between stocks their derivative instruments effort to quell price fluctuations Chicago Mercantile Exchange CME home Standard Poor s stock index futures contract recently announced plans to move contract s settlement to morning quarterly expiration day afternoon New York Stock Exchange Friday intends to implement stricter procedures requiring members to submit all market on close orders blue chip stocks by EST Despite these efforts to ensure smoother contract expirations there sense more might to be done to avert uncontrollable fall prices someday Looming over exchanges twin threats fortified federal regulation congressional action to strap market activity Commodity Futures Trading Commission CFTC Chairman Susan Phillips current regulatory structure adequate to cope intermarket arbitrage but she expects new surveillance procedures enhanced cooperation Securities Exchange Commission SEC SEC Chairman John Shad voicing concern over price volatility associated program trading resurrected proposal opposed by CFTC officials to give federal regulators control over setting futures margins Some contend because futures margins low relative to stock margins portfolio managers tendency to shift out stock index futures falling stock market hastening downward price spiral Absent week s meeting be key congressional player Rep John Dingell D Mi chairman House Energy Commerce Committee head subcommittee responsible overseeing SEC Dingell promised to look into program trading explore ways insuring investors hedgers against market disruptions He interested reviewing margins dual trading practice allows futures brokers to trade their own account before placing customers orders Recently group CME members concerned over perception abuse dual trading proposed banning practice CME board responded plan restrict but ban activity meeting also be attended by regulators Australia Britain France Hong Kong New Zealand Singapore Their appearance coincides controversial CFTC proposal to adopt new regulations over trading foreign futures options on U S exchanges U S exchanges oppose proposed regulations on grounds they prove unnecessarily burdensome Other areas disagreement between CFTC exchanges include requirement exchanges implement strict one minute audit trails by summer proposals to revise federal limits on speculative positions definition hedging CFTC efforts to determine new instruments must be traded on regulated exchanges

text.author: By Larry Welsh Reuters
text.body: Air Canada s U S dlr acquisition Gelco Corp s GEC Canadian unit dramatically altered Canada s fast growing courier industry largely dominated by U S companies until year company officials analysts State owned Air Canada takes over country s second largest overnight courier business just two months after another Canadian company Onex Capital Corp Ltd approved acquisition number one ranked Purolator Courier Ltd New Jersey based Purolator Courier Corp PCC But analysts two acquisitions were prompted by financial restructuring undertaken by U S parent companies likely don t represent industry trend toward buying out foreign owned courier operations It s case whether you can buy right people at right time McLeod Young Weir Ltd transportation analyst Tony Hine commented two acquisitions fit larger move by U S companies embroiled take over or restructuring to sell off their Canadian units to generate ready cash Nesbitt Thomson Deacon Inc analyst Harold Wolkin There very good correlation between U S parent selling Canadian subsidiaries U S parent either being under siege or taking someone else over he Gelco Corp Minnesota decided to sell Gelco Express Ltd as part previously announced program to sell off four operating units to buy back shares pay down debt Gelco Express marketing vice president James O Neil told Reuters sale first under Gelco s divestiture program proceeds be used to help pay down U S dlrs debt by year end company While company officials declined to disclose earnings revenue figures O Neil Gelco Express holds dominant position industry handling more than packages day generating revenues more than Canadian dlrs year earlier move by Purolator to sell Canadian unit formed important part company restructuring program adopted after another Canadian Company Unicorp Canada Corp acquired pct stake Purolator consider acquiring whole company month Purolator agreed to be acquired by company formed by E F Hutton LBO Inc certain managers Purolator s U S courier business Air Canada acquisition Gelco s Canadian courier business represents excellent financial investment market sees growing by to pct annually spokesman Esther Szynkarsky airline also announced acquired pct stake EMS Corp Calgary city messenger service did disclose financial terms but Szynkarsky two acquisitions totalled Canadian dlrs two business combined yearly revenues dlrs She acquisition fit Air Canada s strategy seeking attractive investments compliment main airline business Gelco continue to operate current management independently Air Canada although Air Canada already operates own air cargo business includes small door to door courier operation They re well run they re good investment they re doing well growing market s way we want to keep Szynkarsky Analyst Hine Gelco Purolator Canadian units likely retain operating links their U S delivery network generating traffic former parent companies without them having to tie up capital Canada The nature business incremental traffic incremental revenue Hine It s sort sausage maker business where you put place sausage grinder more sausage you can stuff through more money you make he added

text.title: SHEARSON SELLS NEW CDS FOR JAPANESE BANKS
text.body: Shearson Lehman Brothers Inc sold new type certificate deposit designed to provide top rated Japanese banks broader access to U S money markets investment banker variable money market certificates deposit structured as traditional floating rate CDs rate based on AA commercial paper composite rate Federal Reserve Bank New York Shearson offered novel CDs yesterday to mostly institutional investors series totaled dlrs oversubscribed nearly two billion dlrs bids first banks to issue variable money market CDs were Sanwa Bank Ltd Sumitomo Trust Banking Co Ltd Dai Ichi Kangyo Bank Ltd Fuji Bank Ltd Sumitomo Bank Ltd each tranches dlrs Shearson detailed investment banking firm another series variable money market CDs planned April The variable money market CDs provide low cost dependable source funds issuing Japanese banks Robert Shapiro executive vice president Shearson Lehman Commercial Paper Inc The instrument enables banks to diversify their funding base significant way yesterday s series issuing banks coupon rates were set at commercial bank composite rate plus spread expected to equal all in cost LIBOR minus basis points Shearson rate be reset monthly or quarterly be subject to maximum LIBOR minimum New York Fed s commercial paper composite rate Shearson stressed however spread over commercial paper index to be paid by issuing bank be determined by investor demand added other Japanese banks may participate future issues For first time they the banks gain access only to traditional CD investors but also to commercial paper investors at rates competitive traditional floating rate CDs Michael Balaban vice president Shearson s commercial paper unit He added For U S investors CDs attractive because they domestically issued paper competitive rates offered by AAA rated Japanese banks Balaban noted several fiduciary investors money market funds never previously purchased Japanese bank paper submitted bids during yesterday s sale

text.title: DIVISION SEEN ON HOW TO HELP U S OIL INDUSTRY
text.author: By TED d AFFLISIO Reuters
text.body: The U S Congress oil industry deeply divided on ways government should assist industry hurt by sharp fall oil prices subsequent growth oil imports industry analysts The industry deeply divided between those who support oil tariff those who believe tax incentives better Daniel Yergin director Cambridge Energy Research Associates recently completed survey U S Congress on energy issues Yergin he saw mounting support within Congress tax incentives rather than oil tariff or import fee Today U S Energy Secretary John Herington he propose tax incentives to increase edomestic oil natural gas exploration production to Reagan Administration consideration White House spokesman Marlin Fitzwater proposal be reviewed Herrington I like to shoot one barrels day addition to U S production U S oil output off to bpd week March down six pct year American Petroleum Institute Oil industry analysts forecast oil prices to average dlrs barrel year many believe move above level be unlikey near term Paul Mlotok oil analyst Salomon Brothers Inc even rise prices week or two we ve only altered our average price scenerio to dlrs year Analysts at price renewed drilling exploration to reverse decline U S crude oil output take place as companies waiting stable prices over dlrs to renew exploration John Lichtblau president Petroleum Industry Research Foundation Inc New york recent testimony to Congress The continuing decline U S oil production virtually inevitable under any realistic price scenario But future rate decline very much function world oil prices U S government policy Lichtbalu tax breaks could be used to raise oil production but only work over time Lowering producing industry s tax burden probably be slower stimulant to output than price increase but raise energy costs Lichtblau But small independent oil companies who do much drilling U S looking more immediate relief could be brought on by oil import fee Ronald Tappmeyer president International Association Drilling Contractors The members our trade asssociation convinced only variable oil import fee sets minimum price trigger can protect our nation association represents some drilling oil service companies CERA survey Congress shows oil import fee face stiff uphill battle Yergin poll conducted January by former Congressman Orval Hansen showed support oil import fee pct Congressmen surveyed largely as means protecting domestic petroleum industry At same time pct Congressmen surveyed opposed fee respondents saying tariff hurt consumers some regional interests But pct sample support fee could grow if production continued to fall imports to rise Yergin imports above pct U S requirements is critical symbolic level If they imports move above level fee may be legislated but there certainly be pressure some form action But Lichtblau telephone interview a pct rate import dependency likely to happen before U S oil imports rose to pct u s energy requirements shopuld be pct he added

text.title: SHULTZ SAYS U S PRODUCTS MUST BE COMPETITIVE
text.body: Asked what U S State Department s policy on offering subsidized wheat to Moscow Secretary State George Shultz told group farm leaders U S products must be competitive world market If we going to sell our products whatever they may be wheat or anything else then we to meet market Shultz told board directors National Association Wheat Growers We to be competitive s ridiculous to say somebody going to buy your product if they can get same thing at lower price somewhere else They just aren t he That our approach negotiations Soviets must be our approach as we look at American farm program try to figure out what we should do to make better Shultz told Wheat Growers Schultz while he does favor situation allow Soviet housewife to buy food cheaper than American housewife he realizes importance American agricultural products being competitively priced Speculation been market some time United States considering offering wheat to Soviet Union at subsidized prices Soviet officials they buy U S wheat if were competitively priced Agriculture Department officials declined to take any official position on issue
