reuters.unknown: A RM f reute r f BC BAKER AND VOLCKER SAY

text.title: BAKER AND VOLCKER SAY DEBT STRATEGY WILL WORK
text.author: By Peter Torday Reuters
text.body: Treasury Secretary James Baker Federal Reserve Board chairman Paul Volcker told House leaders they were optimistic their debt strategy work but acknowledged crisis could take sharp turn worse Congressional sources U S officials Baker Volcker gave these views at closed door talks yesterday Speaker Jim Wright other House leaders But two architects Third World debt strategy gave no indications they abandon their plan to promote economic growth reform They expressed optimism current state affairs one participant at meeting However Baker Volcker accompanied by Deputy Secretary State John Whitehead acknowledged there were risks And if things turned sour they could turn very sour source quoted them as saying They were responding to questions Wright Texas Democrat who called meeting two weeks ago because his concern debt crisis deepening aide Speaker asked all three men risks to Latin American democracy danger demagogues either left or right could wrest control halt debt repayments Even though Fed chief joined Baker expressing more confidence optimistic outcome Volcker especially concerned political risks particular fatigue belt tightening central banker resolving debt crisis be struggle Since taking over Speakership at start year Wright shown himself able political adversary administration on budget strategy His involvement issue also seems to signal Congressional interest debt problem to be taken more seriously now than past More worrisome administration strategists possibility Congressional debt proposals essentially granting debt relief be attached to trade bill When Baker Volcker left Speaker s office they knew wasn t just talk one source at meeting two economic policymakers listened patiently to descriptions plans Third World debt facility backed by gold reserves International Monetary Fund agency could buy up or guarantee developing country debt at discount resell to debtor nations undertaking economic reforms U S Treasury be required to ask other countries their views under bill approved by House Banking subcommittee sponsored by John LaFalce New York House Democrat similar proposal being fashioned by Bruce Morrison House Democrat Connecticut sources House Banking Foreign Affairs leaders also attended discussions U S officials both schemes regarded by administration as providing debt relief Baker yesterday concept debt relief misguided If we write all off declare defeat these countries decay wither on vine Treasury Secretary end to capital inflows follow debt relief Baker his own plan broad embrace new innovative text.title: U S HOUSE PANEL VOTES TO EASE EXPORT CONTROLS
text.author: By Jacqueline Frank Reuters
text.body: A key House panel voted to greatly ease government controls on exports as several House committees moved rapidly toward approval major changes trade laws they hope help solve U S trade woes House Foreign Affairs Subcommittee on International Economic Policy voted to direct administration to cut list controlled exports by per cent by removing items no longer considered important to U S military security Industries complained they were losing sales to foreign competitors who were allowed to export freely products U S companies could sell abroad issue been subject administration debate Commerce Department held unnecessary restrictions impeded U S exports while Defense Department current controls should be retained but better administered Four congressional panels met today to consider portions wideranging trade bill intends to help U S companies sell more products abroad to fight unfair foreign trade practices Their separate proposals some them conflicting be woven by House Democratic leaders into final trade bill vote by full House late April Sparked by proposal Fujitsu Ltd to take controlling interest Schlumberger Ltd s Fairchild Semiconductor Corp House Energy Commerce subcommittee on Commerce voted to expand Reagan s authority to block foreign takeovers U S companies Reagan be able to block any takeover found to be damaging to U S economic or national security interests We losing our semiconductors at heart our national security subcommittee chairman James Florio New Jersey Democrat subcommittee also called administration to consider retaliation against Japan restrictive government procurement practices retaliation could be triggered by requirement administration investigate whether U S companies were treated unfairly whether they been barred bids on lucrative public works projects such as eight billion dlr Kansai airport construction U S firms complained they were allowed to bid on construction At urging U S recording industry subcommittee agreed to bar imports new Japanese product digital audio recorders Meeting closed session House Ways Means Committee agreed to allow President Reagan to retaliate against foreign countries refuse to open their markets to U S telecommunications products Congressional aides committee also agreed U S companies be allowed to press relief imports counterfeit products made violation U S copyright patent laws

text.author: By Jonathan Thatcher Reuters
text.body: Property looks set to continue to provide good returns on investment most major cities Asia Australia year poll property analysts bankers economists around region shows better returns often more likely to come buying selling real estate than rental income central Tokyo property analysts project commercial land prices rise year by to pct after year s pct jump main draw local foreign investors Japan Tokyo where top price paid central commercial property year dlrs square meter building land poor Singapore recently sold dlrs meter But analysts Tokyo rents could level off as supply increases slightly strong yen puts prices out reach foreign investors Japanese investors spurred by yen s rise spending record sums on property abroad partly elsewhere Asia but particular U S Where Japanese investment could double year to billion dlrs analysts analysts forecast Hong Kong property prices rise steadily over next few years although surge construction limit increases some areas Property sales become increasingly popular because some sectors market real estate prices as several cities region already outpaced rent yields We still see prices creeping up steadily I don t see why trend should continue over next few months Gareth Williams partner land agent Vigers Hong Kong But he warned investors to bear mind political risk linked to return colony to China several other countries analysts predicted at least some rise property values one or two cases such as Thailand could help spark construction boom Bankers economists Bangkok they expect at least seven pct growth year private sector construction as result government assistance low mortgage rates generally bullish economic outlook Increased confidence economy also improved outlook property Manila after three year slump one Philippine developer Taiwan s property market also set to turn around after five years doldrums according to property developers Taipei They like counterparts many region s capitals cited low interest rates as major factor One leading broker property market become attractive investment Taiwan noting property development yields up to pct Jakarta too plenty new office towers Construction helped cut rents to half levels early s though foreigners usually to rent because limits on property ownership as many parts Asia contrast Australia s easing rules on foreign investment property combined financial deregulation weaker dollar helped spark overseas interest market analysts But always meant sales What we seen increase inquiries particularly Japan but yet to show itself many new deals being done Allan Farrar executive director real estate Elders IXL Ltd s pastoral group Yields on prime Sydney office buildings average pct one analyst forecast pct jump rents year after reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT SAUDI ARABIA RESHAPES ECONOMY
text.author: By Stephen Jukes Reuters
text.body: Higher world oil prices coupled new realism ushered by austerity could lift Saudi Arabia s economy after five years falling revenue growing budget deficits bankers diplomats months ahead prove critical as government attempts balancing act between defending higher oil prices fostering recovery through bigger role private sector Economists oil earnings could recover year to billion dlrs nominal gross domestic product could grow by three pct first rise since But economists be possible only if Organisation Petroleum Exporting Countries OPEC succeeds defending world oil prices if Saudi Arabia forced to curtail output too long Saudi Arabia now keeping production down to defend OPEC s newly established dlr barrel benchmark price Oil Minister Hisham Nazer told Reuters output running at three barrels per day bpd well down on Saudi Arabia s OPEC quota set first half King Fahd stamped his personal authority on OPEC s new found determination to defend prices move Western diplomats believe underlines kingdom s need to secure stable source income economy Saudi Arabia still world s largest oil exporter hugely wealthy country But past five years declining revenue taken their toll Economists estimate gross domestic product fell pct year pct Oil revenue year when prices briefly dipped below dlrs per barrel probably totalled no more than billion dlrs compared to peak billion Austerity still watchword but Saudi Arabia be allowed to dip further into recession Saudis can afford to draw down reserves temporarily to offset worst effects diplomat short term kingdom can lessen impact lower oil revenues gaping budget deficit by drawing on foreign reserves still put at around billion dlrs But such policy cannot be pursued indefinitely Bankers diplomats amount to fiscal recklessness longer term also increases dominance public sector at time when government publicly urging private enterprise to take over lead role economy Bankers diplomats government well aware risks attached to policy but determined to tough out on oil front even if means short term depletion reserves budget deficit targetted at huge billion riyals or pct total outlay budget explicitly recognises need to draw down reserves while foreign borrowing been ruled out Commerce Minister Suleiman Abdulaziz al Salim told Saudi businessmen week government carefully considered need to stimulate economy when drawing up budget plans late year It therefore took bold step withdrawing more than billion riyals reserves pumping into economy he Reserves were built up during late s early s when Saudi Arabia s breakneck pace construction tales high spending became legendary shrinking economy wrought huge changes fabric Kingdom s private sector where poor management gone unpunished easy days oil boom Modern techniques cost control been introduced markets expanded outsized labour forces inventories cut back expatriate workforce fallen sharply number new bankruptcies appears to be declining but Saudi banks hit hard by non performing loans to corporate sector become highly selective extending new credit Government moves to encourage lending investigate company complaints late public sector contract payments could boost confidence but recession slowed nation s industrialisation program discouraged foreign investment Private wealth still very high banks report more more cash being placed on deposit As Saudi Arabia attempts to shift weight economic development public to private sector one biggest tasks be to convince businessmen to channel personal savings into industrial projects within kingdom refrain temptation to invest abroad

text.title: EC SUGAR TENDER SEEN AS CONCESSION TO PRODUCERS
text.body: The rebate granted at yesterday s EC sugar tender represents some concession to producers complaints they losing money on exports outside bloc EC Commission officials maximum rebate European currency units Ecus per kilos Ecus below what producers say needed to obtain equivalent price to offered sales into intervention rebate at week s tender Ecus per kilos short level producers needed officials officials Commission negotiating producers who offered total tonnes sugar sale into intervention apparent attempt to persuade to offer higher rebates They French German producers involved now unable to withdraw offer before April when sugar officially enter intervention stores Payment due five weeks later be open to them to withdraw their offers at any time between April official payment date when Commission officially takes ownership sugar officials officials if Commission to buy sugar determined to immediately resell move drive down market prices further They expressed some hope operators eventually go through their plan intervention sales We think they realise they gone too far one official
